bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to John J. Moran, July 24, 1934

div1.p: Kean accepts Moran's offer to send him his yellow fever clinical chart and comments on conditions in Cuba and the U.S.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to John J. Moran, July 24, 1934
div1.opener:
THE ASSOCIATION OF MILITARY SURGEONS OF THE UNITED STATES
THE MILITARY SURGEON
PRESIDENT
MAJOR GENERAL H. L. GILCHRIST
U. S. ARMY, RETIRED
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
CAPT. WILLIAM SEAMAN BAINBRIDGE
M. C.-F., U. S. N. R., RETIRED
SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT
MED. DIRECTOR CHARLES M. GRIFFITH
U. S. VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION
EDITOR AND SECRETARY
BRIG. GEN. JEFFERSON R. KEAN
UNITED STATES ARMY RET.
THIRD VICE-PRESIDENT
REAR ADMIRAL P. S. ROSSITER
SURGEON GENERAL U. S. NAVY
FOURTH VICE-PRESIDENT
COL. ARTHUR E. LORD
MEDICAL CORPS, ILL. NATIONAL GUARD
FIFTH VICE-PRESIDENT
ASST. SURG. GEN. C. E. WALLER
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO
THE MILITARY SURGEON
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
WASHINGTON, D. C.
24 July, 1934.
Mr. John J. Moran,
Avenida Menocal No. 102-A,
Havana, Cuba.
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
I do not believe that I have replied to your letter of
June 28th in which you offer to give the Library the original
clinical chart of your case of experimental yellow fever. I am
sure that Major Hume wants the chart but he has been away on leave
so that I have not asked him specifically the question. I think
that he would like in connection with it a certificate from you
that it was the original record which Mrs. Gillan, the nurse at
the Army Yellow Fever Hospital, allowed you to take with you as
a souvenir.

It is to be hoped that things are settling in Cuba. I
I have not seen anything in the papers recently about disturbances
there. We are having, however, plenty of labor disturbances in
this country. As for heat, I am sure you have nothing like the
temperature we have had for more than a month now; well up in the
90's during the day and around 80 in the houses at night although
the outside temperature is less.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN
Brig. Gen. U.S. Army, Ret.
Editor. jrk/w
